page.title: 13RELIGION. PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: { {St Michael's Church, Aspley Heath.}The church was built in 1868 in French Gothic style. It was enlarged in 1889.The present vicar is the Rev.A.E. Pullin. {The Methodist Chapel}is situated on the High Street at the corner of Chapel Street.It is an imposing building of red brick, built in l879. The present minister is the Rev.S.J.Barker. {Friends Meeting House}is now the local branch of Buckinghamshire County Library. It was built in 1901 to replace a building which had stood since 1673. There is a burial ground at the rear of the building. {Gospel Hall, Aspley Hill.}is used for worship.The building was erected in 1849 and was formerly used as a Primitive Methodist Chapel.
